{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3122749,"name":"","username":"TheFriendlyStudent","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thefriendlystudent/{size}/180843_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T01:10:48.364Z","cooked":"

Hi, I’m on the programming subteam for my FRC team and I wanted to know what ideas everybody has for getting the robot on the charge station while keeping it level. We’re looking into using gyro inputs in some manner to calibrate the robot when it is on the platform automatically. Any help is greatly appreaciated

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T01:10:48.364Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1020,"reads":962,"readers_count":961,"score":5337.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":422331,"topic_slug":"ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56029,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station/422331/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3122770,"name":"Abi","username":"thesteminist","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thesteminist/{size}/179827_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T01:19:23.149Z","cooked":"

Start by getting yourself one of these:

andymark.com

Pigeon 2.0

This item is restricted for shipment in some countries. Please check international shipping restrictions before ordering.Pigeon is an IMU with 9 degrees of freedom, containing a 3-axis magnetometer, accelerometer, and gyro. The gyro has built-in...

This will enable you to sense the direction and magnitude of the force being put on your robot that is causing it to roll off the CS and compensate with a sufficient amount of motor power to move back to where you want to be (wish I could help out more but I’m not a programmer, I’m sure more will chime in below!).

Not OP but I was wondering if the NavX MXP is capable of this aswell.
NavX mxp

We already have this product and we were planning to use it

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T01:31:54.140Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":835,"readers_count":834,"score":232.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":422331,"topic_slug":"ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55649,"username":"manso","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56029,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station/422331/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3122788,"name":"Zach Hoegberg","username":"Zaque","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zaque/{size}/257827_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T01:48:42.058Z","cooked":"

At the simplest level, you can get the angle of the robot from your pigeon or navx, and use a proportional controller to increase power to the drive motors until you get within some deadband of level. This may work on its own, or you may need to add an integral component to help once the error gets close to zero. Look into PID controllers on the WPILib docs as a starting point, and come back to ask questions once you have reviewed that.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T01:49:14.592Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":817,"readers_count":816,"score":263.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":422331,"topic_slug":"ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station","display_username":"Zach Hoegberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20681,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"112 Drive Coach | 111&112 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station/422331/6","custom_user_title":"112 Drive Coach | 111&112 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3122792,"name":"Aron Rubin","username":"AronRubin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aronrubin/{size}/180072_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T01:53:00.695Z","cooked":"

There are two elements as far as I can tell:

  • Location/Localization - Can you get to the station? Are you on the station?
  • Level - are you perpendicular to gravitational down?
    If you are not level and you drive to fix that you may drive off the ramp so the range is constrained. That is the classical inverted pendulum on a cart. But there is a dead-band in the middle of the charge station rocking mechanism (see here).

tyhf21:

Its a little bit more difficult to get a NavX working reliably in my experience.

Can you expand on this? Are you speaking in general, or are you speaking to getting angle or magnitude?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T02:13:29.886Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":714,"readers_count":713,"score":197.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":422331,"topic_slug":"ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station","display_username":"Mr.R^2","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30291,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station/422331/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3122816,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T02:21:57.400Z","cooked":"

Yes, the navx also has a 3 axis gyro and 3 axis accelerometer to measure this.

Additionally, the roborio has a built in 3-axis accelerometer:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Accelerometers - Software

An accelerometer is a device that measures acceleration. Accelerometers generally come in two types: single-axis and 3-axis. A single-axis accelerometer measures acceleration along one spatial dime...

tyhf21:

Its a little bit more difficult to get a NavX working reliably in my experience.

I’m also curious about this- in my experience, navX has been just about as plug-and-play as it gets.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T02:21:57.400Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":693,"readers_count":692,"score":228.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":422331,"topic_slug":"ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/hardware-apis/sensors/accelerometers-software.html#builtinaccelerometer","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Accelerometers - Software — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":46}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55649,"username":"manso","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station/422331/9","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3122893,"name":"","username":"Ashray.g","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ashray.g/{size}/194161_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T03:53:38.067Z","cooked":"

You might want to consider - is this better than a driver with 2 minutes of practice?

Overall you’re controlling the velocity of a weight moving along a seesaw that may have other weights and nonconservative forces you don’t know consistently. Not only are you controlling theta but also angular velocity and that’s very hard when you don’t know the dynamics of the charging station system.
→ yes you can approximate the dynamics but alliance partners can change that super easily

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T03:53:38.067Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":625,"readers_count":624,"score":180.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":422331,"topic_slug":"ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/pid-loop/422812/5","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Pid loop","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49561,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"retired"},"post_url":"/t/ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station/422331/10","custom_user_title":"retired","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3122914,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T04:08:45.552Z","cooked":"
Ashray.g:

You might want to consider - is this better than a driver with 2 minutes of practice?

For the autonomous balance, which is a massive contributor to the RP, definitely.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-11T04:08:45.552Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":594,"readers_count":593,"score":238.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":422331,"topic_slug":"ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/ideas-for-automatically-balancing-the-robot-on-the-charge-station/422331/11","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3122915,"name":"","username":"Ashray.g","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ashray.g/{size}/194161_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-11T04:09:32.855Z","cooked":"

I mean I feel like a driver can do it much better due to biological intelligence being a bit better than a rough PID (in this case for the reasons I mentioned)

I’m not saying don’t balance

We were able to get it working just using our gyro and translating that to forwards and back movement.

My team is eager to try autonomous balancing. Detecting the gravity vector with an accelerometer ought not to be difficult, but it’s worth pointing out that there’s also a visual indicator on either end of the charging station (LEDs light up when the platform is in the “balanced” zone). I think the accelerometer is no harder to read than a light sensor and gives better data than the LEDs, but it’s worth mentioning.

I don’t know if this code is the best example, but it’s an example to start from.

navX-MXP – 26 Apr 15

Automatic Balancing (FRC)

The Automatic Balancing example demonstrates how to implement a self-balancing robot, which can be useful to help avoid a robot tipping over when driving.  As an example, FRC team 263 demonstrated …

Doesn’t the double hinge mechanism in the charging station result in a 5.3" “dead-zone” in which if your centre of gravity lies there you will not tip, and in fact the platform will self-right?

Is it though? I mean engaged vs balance.
Seems like it would be easy for a team to drive up and turn 90° so as to not roll off. The difference being 4 points not a RP.

Not to derail, so I’ll leave the link.

Activation Bonus Requirement Irks Me Rules/Strategy
Not sure why, but the scoring requirements for the activation bonus RP bugs the hell outta me. 26 pts are required Auto possibilities 0 1 x 8 1 x 12 Endgame 0 (1~3) x 6 (1~3) x 10 …There are no partials here, the charge pad is either level and engaged or not If you get 0 during auto, you have to have 3 engaged bots. OK, cool no issue, it should be harder Here’s the part that bothers me. If you dock during auto, endgame you need 3 docked or 2 engaged wait for it If you engage durin…
